description: .30-06 Springfield ammunition loaded with a 150gr full metal jacket bullet, either surplus or emulating the wartime M2 ball loading.  The .30-06 cartridge has excellent accuracy, range, and stopping power making it popular with hunters and snipers for well over a century.

.30-06 M25 tracer ammunition, loaded with a 146gr full metal jacket tracer bullet to help keep the weapon it is fired from on target.  Traditional practice is to load one tracer per every four normal rounds to help keep the weapon they are fired from on target.  The .30-06 cartridge has excellent accuracy, range, and stopping power making it popular with hunters and snipers for well over a century.

Armor piercing .30-06 M2 ammunition with a 168gr brass jacketed, steel core bullet.  The .30-06 cartridge has excellent accuracy, range, and stopping power making it popular with hunters and snipers for well over a century.

.30-06 Springfield ammunition with a 165gr soft point bullet.  The .30-06 cartridge has excellent accuracy, range, and stopping power making it popular with hunters and snipers for well over a century.  Someone was down on their luck when they handloaded this one - it's filled with black powder instead of smokeless powder.  Expect lower velocity, muzzle smoke, and a dirtier barrel if you shoot it.

.30-06 M25 tracer ammunition, loaded with a 146gr full metal jacket tracer bullet to help keep the weapon it is fired from on target.  Someone was down on their luck when they handloaded this - it's filled with black powder instead of smokeless powder.  Expect lower velocity, muzzle smoke, and a dirtier barrel if you shoot it.

Armor piercing .30-06 M2 ammunition with a 168gr full metal jacket bullet.  It is an extremely powerful and accurate cartridge, but pays for its armor penetration abilities with lowered damage.  Someone was down on their luck when they handloaded this one - it's filled with black powder instead of smokeless powder.  Expect lower velocity, muzzle smoke, and a dirtier barrel if you shoot it.

.30-06 Springfield ammunition with a 165gr soft point bullet.  The .30-06 cartridge has excellent accuracy, range, and stopping power making it popular with hunters and snipers for well over a century.  This one has been handloaded by a survivor or perhaps a pre-Cataclysm hobbyist, leading to slightly inferior performance compared to factory-produced ammo.

.30-06 M25 tracer ammunition, loaded with a 146gr full metal jacket tracer bullet to help keep the weapon it is fired from on target.  It's been handloaded by a survivor or perhaps a pre-Cataclysm hobbyist, leading to slightly inferior performance compared to factory-produced ammo.

Armor piercing .30-06 M2 ammunition with a 168gr full metal jacket bullet.  It is an extremely powerful and accurate cartridge, but pays for its armor penetration abilities with lowered damage.  This one has been handloaded by a survivor or perhaps a pre-Cataclysm hobbyist, leading to slightly inferior performance compared to factory-produced ammo.
